Introduction
Anna does research in Botany, Plant Systematics (Taxonomy), Plant Ecology, Developmental Biology, Genetics and Theoretical Physics. Her current project is "Taxonomy and ecology of Epipactis species (Orchidaceae, Neottieae)". The main research lines go in distinct directions, each one addressing different aspects of this main scientific project.

Taxonomy and ecology of Epipactis species (Orchidaceae, Neottieae)
Project
Epipactis Zinn, 1757 is a young evolutionary genus, which currently undergoes a rapid process of diversification, leading to formation of few complex (aggregate) species. Due to great phenotypic plasticity in response to environmental requirements, formation of small endemic populations, as well as changes in the breeding systems, the taxonomy of the group Helleborine within Epipactis is controversial. Variability caused by different factors, including, e.g., clonal growth of species and genetic variations, results in overlapping morphological features and often imprecise definitions of the given taxa. The results of our research will contribute to better understanding of the phenotypic plasticity of this genus and provide the basis for the revision of the distribution of Epipactis species in Europe.
